trans-unit.source: Serialize data with the Microsoft Avro Library | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Serialize data with the Microsoft Avro Library | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how Azure HDInsight uses Avro to serialize big data.
trans-unit.target: Learn how Azure HDInsight uses Avro to serialize big data.

trans-unit.source: Serialize data in Hadoop with the Microsoft Avro Library
trans-unit.target: Serialize data in Hadoop with the Microsoft Avro Library

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library<html></html> to serialize objects and other data structures into streams in order to persist them to memory, a database, or a file, and also how to deserialize them to recover the original objects.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library<html></html> to serialize objects and other data structures into streams in order to persist them to memory, a database, or a file, and also how to deserialize them to recover the original objects.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Apache Avro
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Apache Avro

trans-unit.source: The <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library<html></html> implements the Apache Avro data serialization system for the Microsoft.NET environment.
trans-unit.target: The <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library<html></html> implements the Apache Avro data serialization system for the Microsoft.NET environment.

trans-unit.source: Apache Avro provides a compact binary data interchange format for serialization.
trans-unit.target: Apache Avro provides a compact binary data interchange format for serialization.

trans-unit.source: It uses <html></html>JSON<html></html> to define a language-agnostic schema that underwrites language interoperability.
trans-unit.target: It uses <html></html>JSON<html></html> to define a language-agnostic schema that underwrites language interoperability.

trans-unit.source: Data serialized in one language can be read in another.
trans-unit.target: Data serialized in one language can be read in another.

trans-unit.source: Currently C, C++, C#, Java, PHP, Python, and Ruby are supported.
trans-unit.target: Currently C, C++, C#, Java, PHP, Python, and Ruby are supported.

trans-unit.source: Detailed information on the format can be found in the <html></html>Apache Avro Specification<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Detailed information on the format can be found in the <html></html>Apache Avro Specification<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the current version of the Microsoft Avro Library does not support the remote procedure calls (RPCs) part of this specification.
trans-unit.target: Note that the current version of the Microsoft Avro Library does not support the remote procedure calls (RPCs) part of this specification.

trans-unit.source: The serialized representation of an object in the Avro system consists of two parts: schema and actual value.
trans-unit.target: The serialized representation of an object in the Avro system consists of two parts: schema and actual value.

trans-unit.source: The Avro schema describes the language-independent data model of the serialized data with JSON.
trans-unit.target: The Avro schema describes the language-independent data model of the serialized data with JSON.

trans-unit.source: It is present side-by-side with a binary representation of data.
trans-unit.target: It is present side-by-side with a binary representation of data.

trans-unit.source: Having the schema separate from the binary representation permits each object to be written with no per-value overheads, making serialization fast and the representation small.
trans-unit.target: Having the schema separate from the binary representation permits each object to be written with no per-value overheads, making serialization fast and the representation small.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>The Hadoop scenario
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>The Hadoop scenario

trans-unit.source: The Apache Avro serialization format is widely used in Azure HDInsight and other Apache Hadoop environments.
trans-unit.target: The Apache Avro serialization format is widely used in Azure HDInsight and other Apache Hadoop environments.

trans-unit.source: Avro provides a convenient way to represent complex data structures within a Hadoop MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Avro provides a convenient way to represent complex data structures within a Hadoop MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: The format of Avro files (Avro object container file) has been designed to support the distributed MapReduce programming model.
trans-unit.target: The format of Avro files (Avro object container file) has been designed to support the distributed MapReduce programming model.

trans-unit.source: The key feature that enables the distribution is that the files are “splittable” in the sense that one can seek any point in a file and start reading from a particular block.
trans-unit.target: The key feature that enables the distribution is that the files are “splittable” in the sense that one can seek any point in a file and start reading from a particular block.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Serialization in the Microsoft Avro Library
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Serialization in the Microsoft Avro Library

trans-unit.source: The .NET Library for Avro supports two ways of serializing objects:
trans-unit.target: The .NET Library for Avro supports two ways of serializing objects:

trans-unit.source: reflection - The JSON schema for the types is automatically built from the data contract attributes of the .NET types to be serialized.
trans-unit.target: reflection - The JSON schema for the types is automatically built from the data contract attributes of the .NET types to be serialized.

trans-unit.source: generic record - A JSON schema is explicitly specified in a record represented by the **AvroRecord** class when no .NET types are present to describe the schema for the data to be serialized.
trans-unit.target: generic record - A JSON schema is explicitly specified in a record represented by the **AvroRecord** class when no .NET types are present to describe the schema for the data to be serialized.

trans-unit.source: When the data schema is known to both the writer and reader of the stream, the data can be sent without its schema.
trans-unit.target: When the data schema is known to both the writer and reader of the stream, the data can be sent without its schema.

trans-unit.source: In cases when an Avro object container file is used, the schema is stored within the file.
trans-unit.target: In cases when an Avro object container file is used, the schema is stored within the file.

trans-unit.source: Other parameters, such as the codec used for data compression, can be specified.
trans-unit.target: Other parameters, such as the codec used for data compression, can be specified.

trans-unit.source: These scenarios are outlined in more detail and illustrated in the code examples below.
trans-unit.target: These scenarios are outlined in more detail and illustrated in the code examples below.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Microsoft Avro Library prerequisites
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Microsoft Avro Library prerequisites

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Microsoft .NET Framework 4<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Microsoft .NET Framework 4<html></html>

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Newtonsoft Json.NET<html></html> (6.0.4 or later)
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Newtonsoft Json.NET<html></html> (6.0.4 or later)

trans-unit.source: Note that the Newtonsoft.Json.dll dependency is downloaded automatically with the installation of the Microsoft Avro Library.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Newtonsoft.Json.dll dependency is downloaded automatically with the installation of the Microsoft Avro Library.

trans-unit.source: The procedure for this is provided in the following section.
trans-unit.target: The procedure for this is provided in the following section.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Microsoft Avro Library installation
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Microsoft Avro Library installation

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Avro Library is distributed as a NuGet package that can be installed from Visual Studio via the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Avro Library is distributed as a NuGet package that can be installed from Visual Studio via the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: Select the Project tab -> Manage NuGet Packages...
trans-unit.target: Select the Project tab -> Manage NuGet Packages...

trans-unit.source: Search for "Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro" in the Search Online box.
trans-unit.target: Search for "Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro" in the Search Online box.

trans-unit.source: Click the Install button next to Microsoft Azure HDInsight Avro Library.
trans-unit.target: Click the Install button next to Microsoft Azure HDInsight Avro Library.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Newtonsoft.Json.dll (>=6.0.4) dependency is also downloaded automatically with the Microsoft Avro Library.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Newtonsoft.Json.dll (>=6.0.4) dependency is also downloaded automatically with the Microsoft Avro Library.

trans-unit.source: You may want to visit the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library home page<html></html> to read the current release notes.
trans-unit.target: You may want to visit the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library home page<html></html> to read the current release notes.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Microsoft Avro Library source code
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Microsoft Avro Library source code

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Avro Library source code is available at the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library home page<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Avro Library source code is available at the <html></html>Microsoft Avro Library home page<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Compiling the schema by using the Microsoft Avro Library
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Compiling the schema by using the Microsoft Avro Library

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Avro Library contains a code generation utility that allows creating C# types automatically based on the previously defined JSON schema.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Avro Library contains a code generation utility that allows creating C# types automatically based on the previously defined JSON schema.

trans-unit.source: The code generation utility is not distributed as a binary executable, but can be easily built via the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: The code generation utility is not distributed as a binary executable, but can be easily built via the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: Download the .zip file with the latest version of HDInsight SDK source code from <html></html>Microsoft .NET SDK For Hadoop<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Download the .zip file with the latest version of HDInsight SDK source code from <html></html>Microsoft .NET SDK For Hadoop<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: (Click the Download icon.)
trans-unit.target: (Click the Download icon.)

trans-unit.source: Extract the HDInsight SDK to a directory on the machine with .NET Framework 4 installed and connected to the Internet for downloading necessary dependency NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: Extract the HDInsight SDK to a directory on the machine with .NET Framework 4 installed and connected to the Internet for downloading necessary dependency NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: Below we will assume that the source code is extracted to C:\SDK.
trans-unit.target: Below we will assume that the source code is extracted to C:\SDK.

trans-unit.source: Go to the folder C:\SDK\src\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools and run build.bat.
trans-unit.target: Go to the folder C:\SDK\src\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools and run build.bat.

trans-unit.source: (The file will call MSBuild from the 32-bit distribution of the .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: (The file will call MSBuild from the 32-bit distribution of the .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to use the 64-bit version, edit build.bat, following the comments inside the file.)
trans-unit.target: If you would like to use the 64-bit version, edit build.bat, following the comments inside the file.)

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the build is successful.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the build is successful.

trans-unit.source: (On some systems, MSBuild may produce warnings.
trans-unit.target: (On some systems, MSBuild may produce warnings.

trans-unit.source: These warnings do not affect the utility as long as there are no build errors.)
trans-unit.target: These warnings do not affect the utility as long as there are no build errors.)

trans-unit.source: The compiled utility is located in C:\SDK\Bin\Unsigned\Release\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools.
trans-unit.target: The compiled utility is located in C:\SDK\Bin\Unsigned\Release\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools.

trans-unit.source: To get familiar with the command-line syntax, execute the following command from the folder where the code generation utility is located: Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools help /c:codegen
trans-unit.target: To get familiar with the command-line syntax, execute the following command from the folder where the code generation utility is located: Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools help /c:codegen

trans-unit.source: To test the utility, you can generate C# classes from the sample JSON schema file provided with the source code.
trans-unit.target: To test the utility, you can generate C# classes from the sample JSON schema file provided with the source code.

trans-unit.source: Execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: Execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: This is supposed to produce two C# files in the current directory: SensorData.cs and Location.cs.
trans-unit.target: This is supposed to produce two C# files in the current directory: SensorData.cs and Location.cs.

trans-unit.source: To understand the logic that the code generation utility is using while converting the JSON schema to C# types, see the file GenerationVerification.feature located in C:\SDK\src\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools\Doc.
trans-unit.target: To understand the logic that the code generation utility is using while converting the JSON schema to C# types, see the file GenerationVerification.feature located in C:\SDK\src\Microsoft.Hadoop.Avro.Tools\Doc.

trans-unit.source: Please note that namespaces are extracted from the JSON schema, using the logic described in the file mentioned in the previous paragraph.
trans-unit.target: Please note that namespaces are extracted from the JSON schema, using the logic described in the file mentioned in the previous paragraph.

trans-unit.source: Namespaces extracted from the schema take precedence over whatever is provided with the /n parameter in the utility command line.
trans-unit.target: Namespaces extracted from the schema take precedence over whatever is provided with the /n parameter in the utility command line.

trans-unit.source: If you want to override the namespaces contained within the schema, use the /nf parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you want to override the namespaces contained within the schema, use the /nf parameter.

trans-unit.source: For example, to change all namespaces from the SampleJSONSchema.avsc to my.own.nspace, execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: For example, to change all namespaces from the SampleJSONSchema.avsc to my.own.nspace, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Guide to the samples for the Microsoft Avro Library
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Guide to the samples for the Microsoft Avro Library

trans-unit.source: Six examples provided in this topic illustrate different scenarios supported by the Microsoft Avro Library.
trans-unit.target: Six examples provided in this topic illustrate different scenarios supported by the Microsoft Avro Library.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Avro Library is designed to work with any stream.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Avro Library is designed to work with any stream.

trans-unit.source: In these examples, data is manipulated via memory streams rather than file streams or databases for simplicity and consistency.
trans-unit.target: In these examples, data is manipulated via memory streams rather than file streams or databases for simplicity and consistency.

trans-unit.source: The approach taken in a production environment will depend on the exact scenario requirements, data source and volume, performance constraints, and other factors.
trans-unit.target: The approach taken in a production environment will depend on the exact scenario requirements, data source and volume, performance constraints, and other factors.

trans-unit.source: The first two examples show how to serialize and deserialize data into memory stream buffers by using reflection and generic records.
trans-unit.target: The first two examples show how to serialize and deserialize data into memory stream buffers by using reflection and generic records.

trans-unit.source: The schema in these two cases is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers out-of-band.
trans-unit.target: The schema in these two cases is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers out-of-band.

trans-unit.source: The third and fourth examples show how to serialize and deserialize data by using the Avro object container files.
trans-unit.target: The third and fourth examples show how to serialize and deserialize data by using the Avro object container files.

trans-unit.source: When data is stored in an Avro container file, its schema is always stored with it because the schema must be shared for deserialization.
trans-unit.target: When data is stored in an Avro container file, its schema is always stored with it because the schema must be shared for deserialization.

trans-unit.source: The sample containing the first four examples can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.
trans-unit.target: The sample containing the first four examples can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.

trans-unit.source: The fifth example shows how to how to use a custom compression codec for Avro object container files.
trans-unit.target: The fifth example shows how to how to use a custom compression codec for Avro object container files.

trans-unit.source: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.
trans-unit.target: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.

trans-unit.source: The sixth sample shows how to use Avro serialization to upload data to Azure Blob storage and then analyze it by using Hive with an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.
trans-unit.target: The sixth sample shows how to use Avro serialization to upload data to Azure Blob storage and then analyze it by using Hive with an HDInsight (Hadoop) cluster.

trans-unit.source: It can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.
trans-unit.target: It can be downloaded from the <html></html>Azure code samples<html></html> site.

trans-unit.source: Here are links to the six samples discussed in the topic:
trans-unit.target: Here are links to the six samples discussed in the topic:

trans-unit.source: Serialization with reflection - The JSON schema for types to be serialized is automatically built from the data contract attributes.
trans-unit.target: Serialization with reflection - The JSON schema for types to be serialized is automatically built from the data contract attributes.

trans-unit.source: Serialization with generic record - The JSON schema is explicitly specified in a record when no .NET type is available for reflection.
trans-unit.target: Serialization with generic record - The JSON schema is explicitly specified in a record when no .NET type is available for reflection.

trans-unit.source: Serialization using object container files with reflection - The JSON schema is automatically built and shared together with the serialized data via an Avro object container file.
trans-unit.target: Serialization using object container files with reflection - The JSON schema is automatically built and shared together with the serialized data via an Avro object container file.

trans-unit.source: Serialization using object container files with generic record - The JSON schema is explicitly specified before the serialization and shared together with the data via an Avro object container file.
trans-unit.target: Serialization using object container files with generic record - The JSON schema is explicitly specified before the serialization and shared together with the data via an Avro object container file.

trans-unit.source: Serialization using object container files with a custom compression codec - The example shows how to create an Avro object container file with a customized .NET implementation of the Deflate data compression codec.
trans-unit.target: Serialization using object container files with a custom compression codec - The example shows how to create an Avro object container file with a customized .NET implementation of the Deflate data compression codec.

trans-unit.source: Using Avro to upload data for the Microsoft Azure HDInsight service - The example illustrates how Avro serialization interacts with the HDInsight service.
trans-unit.target: Using Avro to upload data for the Microsoft Azure HDInsight service - The example illustrates how Avro serialization interacts with the HDInsight service.

trans-unit.source: An active Azure subscription and access to an Azure HDInsight cluster are required to run this example.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure subscription and access to an Azure HDInsight cluster are required to run this example.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 1: Serialization with reflection
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 1: Serialization with reflection

trans-unit.source: The JSON schema for the types can be automatically built by the Microsoft Avro Library via reflection from the data contract attributes of the C# objects to be serialized. The Microsoft Avro Library creates an [**IAvroSeralizer<html></html>**](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627341.aspx) to identify the fields to be serialized.
trans-unit.target: The JSON schema for the types can be automatically built by the Microsoft Avro Library via reflection from the data contract attributes of the C# objects to be serialized. The Microsoft Avro Library creates an [**IAvroSeralizer<html></html>**](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627341.aspx) to identify the fields to be serialized.

trans-unit.source: In this example, objects (a SensorData class with a member Location struct) are serialized to a memory stream, and this stream is in turn deserialized.
trans-unit.target: In this example, objects (a SensorData class with a member Location struct) are serialized to a memory stream, and this stream is in turn deserialized.

trans-unit.source: The result is then compared to the initial instance to confirm that the SensorData object recovered is identical to the original.
trans-unit.target: The result is then compared to the initial instance to confirm that the SensorData object recovered is identical to the original.

trans-unit.source: The schema in this example is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers, so the Avro object container format is not required.
trans-unit.target: The schema in this example is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers, so the Avro object container format is not required.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to serialize and deserialize data into memory buffers by using reflection with the object container format when the schema must be shared with the data, see <html></html>Serialization using object container files with reflection<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to serialize and deserialize data into memory buffers by using reflection with the object container format when the schema must be shared with the data, see <html></html>Serialization using object container files with reflection<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 2: Serialization with a generic record
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 2: Serialization with a generic record

trans-unit.source: A JSON schema can be explicitly specified in a generic record when reflection cannot be used because the data cannot be represented via .NET classes with a data contract.
trans-unit.target: A JSON schema can be explicitly specified in a generic record when reflection cannot be used because the data cannot be represented via .NET classes with a data contract.

trans-unit.source: This method is generally slower than using reflection.
trans-unit.target: This method is generally slower than using reflection.

trans-unit.source: In such cases, the schema for the data may also be dynamic, i.e., not be known at compile time.
trans-unit.target: In such cases, the schema for the data may also be dynamic, i.e., not be known at compile time.

trans-unit.source: Data represented as comma-separated values (CSV) files whose schema is unknown until it is transformed to the Avro format at run time is an example of this sort of dynamic scenario.
trans-unit.target: Data represented as comma-separated values (CSV) files whose schema is unknown until it is transformed to the Avro format at run time is an example of this sort of dynamic scenario.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to create and use an <link><linkText>**AvroRecord**</linkText><title></title></link> to explicitly specify a JSON schema, how to populate it with the data, and then how to serialize and deserialize it.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to create and use an <link><linkText>**AvroRecord**</linkText><title></title></link> to explicitly specify a JSON schema, how to populate it with the data, and then how to serialize and deserialize it.

trans-unit.source: The result is then compared to the initial instance to confirm that the record recovered is identical to the original.
trans-unit.target: The result is then compared to the initial instance to confirm that the record recovered is identical to the original.

trans-unit.source: The schema in this example is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers, so the Avro object container format is not required.
trans-unit.target: The schema in this example is assumed to be shared between the readers and writers, so the Avro object container format is not required.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to serialize and deserialize data into memory buffers by using a generic record with the object container format when the schema must be included with the serialized data, see the <html></html>Serialization using object container files with generic record<html></html> example.
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to serialize and deserialize data into memory buffers by using a generic record with the object container format when the schema must be included with the serialized data, see the <html></html>Serialization using object container files with generic record<html></html> example.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 3: Serialization using object container files and serialization with reflection
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 3: Serialization using object container files and serialization with reflection

trans-unit.source: This example is similar to the scenario in the <html></html> first example<html></html>, where the schema is implicitly specified with reflection.
trans-unit.target: This example is similar to the scenario in the <html></html> first example<html></html>, where the schema is implicitly specified with reflection.

trans-unit.source: The difference is that here, the schema is not assumed to be known to the reader that deserializes it.
trans-unit.target: The difference is that here, the schema is not assumed to be known to the reader that deserializes it.

trans-unit.source: The SensorData objects to be serialized and their implicitly specified schema are stored in an Avro object container file represented by the **AvroContainer** class.
trans-unit.target: The SensorData objects to be serialized and their implicitly specified schema are stored in an Avro object container file represented by the **AvroContainer** class.

trans-unit.source: The data is serialized in this example with [**SequentialWriter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627340.aspx) and deserialized with [SequentialReader**](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627340.aspx). The result then is compared to the initial instances to ensure identity.
trans-unit.target: The data is serialized in this example with [**SequentialWriter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627340.aspx) and deserialized with [SequentialReader**](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn627340.aspx). The result then is compared to the initial instances to ensure identity.

trans-unit.source: The data in the object container file is compressed via the default <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-100]</linkText><title></title></link> compression codec from .NET Framework 4.
trans-unit.target: The data in the object container file is compressed via the default <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-100]</linkText><title></title></link> compression codec from .NET Framework 4.

trans-unit.source: See the <html></html> fifth example<html></html> in this topic to learn how to use a more recent and superior version of the <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-110]</linkText><title></title></link> compression codec available in .NET Framework 4.5.
trans-unit.target: See the <html></html> fifth example<html></html> in this topic to learn how to use a more recent and superior version of the <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-110]</linkText><title></title></link> compression codec available in .NET Framework 4.5.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 4: Serialization using object container files and serialization with generic record
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 4: Serialization using object container files and serialization with generic record

trans-unit.source: This example is similar to the scenario in the <html></html> second example<html></html>, where the schema is explicitly specified with JSON.
trans-unit.target: This example is similar to the scenario in the <html></html> second example<html></html>, where the schema is explicitly specified with JSON.

trans-unit.source: The difference is that here, the schema is not assumed to be known to the reader that deserializes it.
trans-unit.target: The difference is that here, the schema is not assumed to be known to the reader that deserializes it.

trans-unit.source: The test data set is collected into a list of <link><linkText>**AvroRecord**</linkText><title></title></link> objects via an explicitly defined JSON schema and then stored in an object container file represented by the <link><linkText>**AvroContainer**</linkText><title></title></link> class.
trans-unit.target: The test data set is collected into a list of <link><linkText>**AvroRecord**</linkText><title></title></link> objects via an explicitly defined JSON schema and then stored in an object container file represented by the <link><linkText>**AvroContainer**</linkText><title></title></link> class.

trans-unit.source: This container file creates a writer that is used to serialize the data, uncompressed, to a memory stream that is then saved to a file.
trans-unit.target: This container file creates a writer that is used to serialize the data, uncompressed, to a memory stream that is then saved to a file.

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>**Codec.Null**</linkText><title></title></link> parameter used for creating the reader specifies that this data will not be compressed.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>**Codec.Null**</linkText><title></title></link> parameter used for creating the reader specifies that this data will not be compressed.

trans-unit.source: The data is then read from the file and deserialized into a collection of objects.
trans-unit.target: The data is then read from the file and deserialized into a collection of objects.

trans-unit.source: This collection is compared to the initial list of Avro records to confirm that they are identical.
trans-unit.target: This collection is compared to the initial list of Avro records to confirm that they are identical.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 5: Serialization using object container files with a custom compression codec
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 5: Serialization using object container files with a custom compression codec

trans-unit.source: The fifth example shows how to how to use a custom compression codec for Avro object container files.
trans-unit.target: The fifth example shows how to how to use a custom compression codec for Avro object container files.

trans-unit.source: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>Azure code samples</linkText><title></title></link> site.
trans-unit.target: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>Azure code samples</linkText><title></title></link> site.

trans-unit.source: The Avro Specification allows usage of an optional compression codec (in addition to Null and Deflate defaults).
trans-unit.target: The Avro Specification allows usage of an optional compression codec (in addition to Null and Deflate defaults).

trans-unit.source: This example is not implementing a completely new codec such as Snappy (mentioned as a supported optional codec in the <link><linkText>Avro Specification</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This example is not implementing a completely new codec such as Snappy (mentioned as a supported optional codec in the <link><linkText>Avro Specification</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It shows how to use the .NET Framework 4.5 implementation of the <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-110]</linkText><title></title></link> codec, which provides a better compression algorithm based on the <link><linkText>zlib</linkText><title></title></link> compression library than the default .NET Framework 4 version.
trans-unit.target: It shows how to use the .NET Framework 4.5 implementation of the <link><linkText>**Deflate**[deflate-110]</linkText><title></title></link> codec, which provides a better compression algorithm based on the <link><linkText>zlib</linkText><title></title></link> compression library than the default .NET Framework 4 version.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sample 6: Using Avro to upload data for the Microsoft Azure HDInsight service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sample 6: Using Avro to upload data for the Microsoft Azure HDInsight service

trans-unit.source: The sixth example illustrates some programming techniques related to interacting with the Azure HDInsight service.
trans-unit.target: The sixth example illustrates some programming techniques related to interacting with the Azure HDInsight service.

trans-unit.source: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>Azure code samples</linkText><title></title></link> site.
trans-unit.target: A sample containing the code for this example can be downloaded from the <link><linkText>Azure code samples</linkText><title></title></link> site.

trans-unit.source: The sample does the following:
trans-unit.target: The sample does the following:

trans-unit.source: Connects to an existing HDInsight service cluster.
trans-unit.target: Connects to an existing HDInsight service cluster.

trans-unit.source: Serializes several CSV files and uploads the result to Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Serializes several CSV files and uploads the result to Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: (The CSV files are distributed together with the sample and represent an extract from AMEX Stock historical data distributed by <link><linkText>Infochimps</linkText><title></title></link> for the period 1970-2010.
trans-unit.target: (The CSV files are distributed together with the sample and represent an extract from AMEX Stock historical data distributed by <link><linkText>Infochimps</linkText><title></title></link> for the period 1970-2010.

trans-unit.source: The sample reads CSV file data, converts the records to instances of the Stock class, and then serializes them by using reflection.
trans-unit.target: The sample reads CSV file data, converts the records to instances of the Stock class, and then serializes them by using reflection.

trans-unit.source: Stock type definition is created from a JSON schema via the Microsoft Avro Library code generation utility.
trans-unit.target: Stock type definition is created from a JSON schema via the Microsoft Avro Library code generation utility.

trans-unit.source: Creates a new external table called Stocks in Hive, and links it to the data uploaded in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new external table called Stocks in Hive, and links it to the data uploaded in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Executes a query by using Hive over the Stocks table.
trans-unit.target: Executes a query by using Hive over the Stocks table.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the sample performs a clean-up procedure before and after performing major operations.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the sample performs a clean-up procedure before and after performing major operations.

trans-unit.source: During the clean-up, all of the related Azure Blob data and folders are removed, and the Hive table is dropped.
trans-unit.target: During the clean-up, all of the related Azure Blob data and folders are removed, and the Hive table is dropped.

trans-unit.source: You can also invoke the clean-up procedure from the sample command line.
trans-unit.target: You can also invoke the clean-up procedure from the sample command line.

trans-unit.source: The sample has the following prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: The sample has the following prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: An active Microsoft Azure subscription and its subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: An active Microsoft Azure subscription and its subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: A management certificate for the subscription with the corresponding private key.
trans-unit.target: A management certificate for the subscription with the corresponding private key.

trans-unit.source: The certificate should be installed in the current user private storage on the machine used to run the sample.
trans-unit.target: The certificate should be installed in the current user private storage on the machine used to run the sample.

trans-unit.source: An active HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An active HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: An Azure Storage account linked to the HDInsight cluster from the previous prerequisite, together with the corresponding primary or secondary access key.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Storage account linked to the HDInsight cluster from the previous prerequisite, together with the corresponding primary or secondary access key.

trans-unit.source: All of the information from the prerequisites should be entered to the sample configuration file before the sample is run.
trans-unit.target: All of the information from the prerequisites should be entered to the sample configuration file before the sample is run.

trans-unit.source: There are two possible ways to do it:
trans-unit.target: There are two possible ways to do it:

trans-unit.source: Edit the app.config file in the sample root directory and then build the sample
trans-unit.target: Edit the app.config file in the sample root directory and then build the sample

trans-unit.source: First build the sample, and then edit AvroHDISample.exe.config in the build directory
trans-unit.target: First build the sample, and then edit AvroHDISample.exe.config in the build directory

trans-unit.source: In both cases all edits should be done in the **<html></html>** settings section. Please follow the comments in the file.
trans-unit.target: In both cases all edits should be done in the **<html></html>** settings section. Please follow the comments in the file.

trans-unit.source: The sample is run from the command line by executing the following command (where the .zip file with the sample was assumed to be extracted to C:\AvroHDISample; if otherwise, use the relevant file path):
trans-unit.target: The sample is run from the command line by executing the following command (where the .zip file with the sample was assumed to be extracted to C:\AvroHDISample; if otherwise, use the relevant file path):
